Gua Tempat 12 Bocah Thailand Terjebak Dibuka Lagi buat Turis
07 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Wahyu Setyo Widodo


Gua Tham Luang di Thailand (REUTERS/Stringer)

Chiang Rai - Masih ingat kisah 12 bocah di Thailand yang terjebak selama 2 minggu di dalam gua? Sekarang gua tersebut akan kembali dibuka untuk turis. Minat ke sini, traveler?Gua Tham Luang, gua tempat 12 bocah Thailand terjebak selama 2 minggu akan dibuka lagi untuk dikunjungi wisatawan. Pengumuman ini disampaikan oleh Pemprov Chiang Rai pada Jumat (1/11) pekan lalu.Dihimpun detikTravel dari beberapa sumber, Pemerintah Provinsi Chiang Rai mempersilakan turis untuk datang hanya pada batas-batas yang diizinkan di bagian mulut gua. Kurang lebih ada 30 meter bagian gua yang dibuka buat turis.Ada 3 bagian gua yang bisa dikunjungi traveler. Bagian pertama yaitu kuil untuk menghormati Putri Jao Mae Nang Non, kemudian bagian mulut gua dimana 12 bocah masuk dan terjebak, dan terakhir bagian pintu keluar gua.Pada pintu masuk gua, sudah dibatasi besi-besi dengan alasan keamanan. Jumlah pengunjung yang bisa masuk ke area yang diizinkan sekitar 30 orang. Setiap hari, kapasitas masuk di gua ini sekitar 2.000 orang.Meski sempat menjadi saksi bisu terjebaknya 12 bocah selama 2 minggu, tetapi animo turis untuk berkunjung ke gua ini relatif besar. Pada saat pertama kali dibuka untuk umum, ada sekitar 2.000 orang berkunjung ke gua ini.Kisah 12 bocah yang tergabung dalam tim sepakbola Wild Boars dan terjebak di dalam Gua Tham Luang itu memang sempat amat menyita perhatian dunia. Selama total 17 hari mereka terperangkap di dalam gua. Proses evakuasi mereka juga tak kalah heroiknya. Sampai-sampai ada anggota Angkatan Laut Thailand yang jatuh menjadi korban demi menyelamatkan 12 bocah ini. Traveler yang penasaran dengan rupa Gua Tham Luang bisa berkunjung ke sini bila liburan ke Thailand.Simak Video "Bom Guncang 4 Lokasi Berbeda di Bangkok, 2 Orang Terluka"[Gambas:Video 20detik](wsw/krs)

Cave Place 12 Thai Boy Trapped Opened Again for Tourists
07 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Wahyu Setyo Widodo


Tham Luang Cave in Thailand (REUTERS / Stringer)

Chiang Rai - Still remember the story of 12 children in Thailand who were trapped for 2 weeks in a cave? Now the cave will be reopened for tourists. Interest here, traveler? Tham Luang Cave, a cave where 12 Thai children have been trapped for 2 weeks will be opened again for tourists to visit. This announcement was made by the Provincial Government of Chiang Rai on Friday (1/11) last week. Compiled by TravelTravel from several sources, the Chiang Rai Provincial Government invited tourists to come only to the limits allowed at the mouth of the cave. There are approximately 30 meters of the cave which is opened for tourists. There are 3 parts of the cave that can be visited by a traveler. The first part is the temple in honor of Princess Jao Mae Nang Non, then the mouth of the cave where 12 children enter and are trapped, and finally the exit of the cave. At the entrance of the cave, iron is restricted by security reasons. The number of visitors who can enter the permitted area is around 30 people. Every day, the entrance capacity in this cave is around 2,000 people. Although it was a silent witness of the trapping of 12 children for 2 weeks, but the interest of tourists to visit this cave is relatively large. When it was first opened to the public, there were around 2,000 people visited this cave. The story of 12 children who joined the Wild Boars soccer team and were trapped in the Cave of Tham Luang was indeed very attention-grabbing world attention. For a total of 17 days they were trapped in the cave. Their evacuation process is no less heroic. To the extent that there are members of the Thai Navy who fell victim to save these 12 children. Traveler who is curious about the appearance of Tham Luang Cave can visit here on holiday in Thailand.
